channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Strike on children’s hospital marks another Ukrainian facility hit by Russian attack
item.description: The funeral for a doctor who was killed in a Russian missile strike on a children's hospital in Kyiv accentuates the wartime danger and losses for Ukraine's medical community.
item.content:encoded: The funeral for a doctor who was killed in a Russian missile strike on a children's hospital in Kyiv accentuates the wartime danger and losses for Ukraine's medical community.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Westerman

item.title: Rabies could become a disease of the past. Here's what it would take
item.description: The Americas has made extraordinary progress, mainly by vaccinating canines. Asia and Africa —- where 95% of rabies cases happen —- have two obstacles to progress.
item.content:encoded:
The Americas has made extraordinary progress, mainly by vaccinating canines. Asia and Africa —- where 95% of rabies cases happen —- have two obstacles to progress.

(Image credit: Josefiel Rivera/SOPA Images/LightRocket)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: If Biden dropped out, how long would it take a candidate to set up a viable campaign?
item.description: President Biden says he's staying in the race. But if fellow Democrats should persuade him to leave, what is the realistic timeline to stand-up a new campaign?
item.content:encoded: President Biden says he's staying in the race. But if fellow Democrats should persuade him to leave, what is the realistic timeline to stand-up a new campaign?
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: AI brings soaring emissions for Google and Microsoft, a major contributor to climate change
item.description: The tech giants both report surges in greenhouse gas emissions as they double-down on adding artificial intelligence to all of their products.
item.content:encoded:
The tech giants both report surges in greenhouse gas emissions as they double-down on adding artificial intelligence to all of their products.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Sexual assault cases involving U.S. military personnel strain relations with Japan
item.description: Allegations of U.S. military servicemen's sexual assaults against women in Okinawa have been an irritant to the U.S.-Japan alliance. Several cases, which were kept from the public, have come to light.
item.content:encoded: Allegations of U.S. military servicemen's sexual assaults against women in Okinawa have been an irritant to the U.S.-Japan alliance. Several cases, which were kept from the public, have come to light.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: A former inmate finds meaning through his work as a death doula
item.description: In this week's StoryCorps, Michael Rogers came to the StoryCorps booth to talk about how his work as a death doula changed his perspective on life.
item.content:encoded: In this week's StoryCorps, Michael Rogers came to the StoryCorps booth to talk about how his work as a death doula changed his perspective on life.
item.dc:creator: Jey Born

item.title: Social media is fueling a tween skin care craze. Some dermatologists are wary
item.description: Tweens are now major consumers of skin care products, fueled by social media. But dermatologists are seeing kids with rashes caused by products not meant for young skin. What should tweens be using?
item.content:encoded:
Tweens are now major consumers of skin care products, fueled by social media. But dermatologists are seeing kids with rashes caused by products not meant for young skin. What should tweens be using?

(Image credit: Anton Novikov)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: What celebrity loves Biden — but wants him to drop out? Find out in the quiz
item.description: In other news, Nikki Haley did a thing, Trump says he doesn't know a thing, and the Republican platform ignored a thing.
item.content:encoded: In other news, Nikki Haley did a thing, Trump says he doesn't know a thing, and the Republican platform ignored a thing.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Hiking during extreme heat can be deadly. Here's why and how to stay safe
item.description: Heat records have been crumbling this summer in the U.S., creating dangerous conditions for those exerting themselves outside. When the body gets overheated, it struggles to perform basic functions.
item.content:encoded:
Heat records have been crumbling this summer in the U.S., creating dangerous conditions for those exerting themselves outside. When the body gets overheated, it struggles to perform basic functions.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: How to live without plastics for a month, according to the founder of a global movement
item.description: Plastic Free July is upon us! Rebecca Prince-Ruiz, founder of Plastic Free July, encourages people to take the challenge with friends, start small and keep a “plastic-free kit” on hand.
item.content:encoded:
Plastic Free July is upon us! Rebecca Prince-Ruiz, founder of Plastic Free July, encourages people to take the challenge with friends, start small and keep a “plastic-free kit” on hand.

(Image credit: Zayrha Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Claire Murashima
